description: Canva offers a drag-and-drop design suite for creating social media graphics, presentations, and marketing materials with prebuilt templates and a vast element library

tools.name: CANVA_ACCESS_USER_SPECIFIC_BRAND_TEMPLATES_LIST
tools.description: Lists brand templates available to the user (Canva Enterprise only). This endpoint retrieves all brand templates the user has access to. Brand templates are pre-designed layouts with variable data fields that can be populated programmatically using the autofill API. Returns template metadata including IDs, names, and dataset schemas.

query.title: Query
query.description: Lets you search the brand templates available to the user using a search term or terms.

dataset.title: DatasetEnm
dataset.description: Filter the list of brand templates based on the brand templates" dataset definitions. Brand templates with dataset definitions are mainly used with the [Autofill APIs](https://www.canva.dev/docs/connect/api-reference/autofills/). This can be one of the following: - `any`: (Default) Brand templates with and without dataset definitions. - `non_empty`: Brand templates with one or more data fields defined. - `empty`: Brand templates with no data fields defined.

sort_by.title: SortByEnm
sort_by.description: Sort the list of brand templates. This can be one of the following: - `relevance`: (Default) Sort results using a relevance algorithm. - `modified_descending`: Sort results by the date last modified in descending order. - `modified_ascending`: Sort results by the date last modified in ascending order. - `title_descending`: Sort results by title in descending order. - `title_ascending`: Sort results by title in ascending order.

ownership.title: OwnershipEnm
ownership.description: Filter the list of brand templates based on the user"s ownership of the brand templates. This can be one of the following: - `any`: (Default) Brand templates owned by and shared with the user. - `owned`: Brand templates owned by the user. - `shared`: Brand templates shared with the user.

continuation.title: Continuation
continuation.description: If the success response contains a continuation token, the user has access to more brand templates you can list. You can use this token as a query parameter and retrieve more templates from the list, for example `/v1/brand-templates?continuation={continuation}`. To retrieve all the brand templates available to the user, you might need to make multiple requests.

tools.name: CANVA_CREATE_ASSET_UPLOAD_JOB
tools.description: Uploads an asset file to the user's Canva content library. This endpoint initiates an asynchronous upload job for images, videos, audio files, PDFs, or fonts. Returns a job ID to track the upload progress. Once complete, the asset can be used in designs, referenced by its asset ID, and managed through other asset endpoints. IMPORTANT: This is an async operation. Use CANVA_FETCH_ASSET_UPLOAD_JOB_STATUS to poll the job status until it reaches 'success' or 'failed' status.

inputSchema.title: CreateAssetUploadJobRequest

file.title: FileUploadable
file.description: File to upload. Size limits: Images 50MB, Videos 100MB, Audio 10MB. Supported: JPEG/PNG/GIF/WebP/SVG, MP4/MOV/AVI, MP3/WAV, PDF, TTF/OTF fonts. No duplicate detection - uploading same file creates new asset.

name.title: Name
name.description: Display name for the asset (max 50 chars). Used for searching in Canva. Longer names are truncated. Special chars allowed. Cannot be changed via API after upload.

inputSchema.description:
Request schema to upload an asset to a user's content library.

Canva expects an application/octet-stream body and an Asset-Upload-Metadata
header containing the upload metadata.

tools.name: CANVA_CREATE_CANVA_DESIGN_EXPORT_JOB
tools.description: Exports a Canva design to various file formats. This endpoint initiates an asynchronous export job for designs. Supports image formats (PNG, JPG, GIF), documents (PDF, PPTX), and video (MP4). Each format has specific configuration options like dimensions, quality, and page selection. IMPORTANT: This is an async operation. Use GET_DESIGN_EXPORT_JOB_RESULT to poll the job status until completion and retrieve the download URLs for the exported files.

inputSchema.title: CreateCanvaDesignExportJobRequest

format.title: Format

inputSchema.description: Request to export a Canva design to a file format.

tools.name: CANVA_CREATE_CANVA_DESIGN_WITH_OPTIONAL_ASSET
tools.description: Creates a new Canva design with specified dimensions or from an asset. This endpoint creates a design using either a preset type (doc, presentation, whiteboard), custom dimensions, or by importing an image asset. Returns the design ID, URLs for editing and viewing, owner info, and metadata. The design can be immediately accessed and edited.

inputSchema.title: CreateCanvaDesignWithOptionalAssetRequest

title.title: Title
title.description: Design title (1-255 chars). Appears in Canva UI and design lists.

asset_id.title: Asset Id
asset_id.description: Image asset ID to create design from. Optional if design_type provided. Must reference an image asset only - videos/PDFs are not supported.

design_type.title: Design Type

inputSchema.description:
Request schema for `CreateCanvaDesignWithOptionalAsset`

Conditional requirements:
- At least one of 'design_type' or 'asset_id' must be provided.
- When 'design_type.type' = 'preset', 'design_type.name' must be one of: doc, whiteboard, presentation.
- 'asset_id' currently supports images only (per Canva API docs).

You can either provide a preset/custom design_type or rely on an asset-only creation.
You may also provide an image asset_id to insert into the new design. Currently,
only image assets are supported for insertion via asset_id.

IMPORTANT: One of 'design_type' or 'asset_id' must be defined. If neither is provided,
the API will return a 400 error.

tools.name: CANVA_CREATE_COMMENT_REPLY_IN_DESIGN
tools.description: This preview API allows replying to comments within a design on Canva, with a limit of 100 replies per comment. Users should note potential unannounced changes, and that preview APIs are not eligible for public integrations.

message.title: Message
message.description: The reply comment message. This is the reply comment body shown in the Canva UI. You can also mention users in your message by specifying their User ID and Team ID using the format `[user_id:team_id]`.

tools.name: CANVA_CREATE_DESIGN_COMMENT_IN_PREVIEW_API
tools.description: Creates a new comment thread on a Canva design. This preview API allows adding text comments to designs for collaboration and feedback. Returns the created comment with ID, author info, and timestamp. Comments can be replied to using the comment reply endpoint.

message.title: Message
examples: Great design! Love the color scheme.
message.description: Comment text (max 4096 chars). Mention users with [user_id:team_id]. No markdown support. Comments appear unpinned - users must view 'All pages' to see them.

design_id.title: Design Id
design_id.description: Design ID to attach comment to

assignee_id.title: Assignee Id
assignee_id.description: User ID to assign this comment to. If provided, you must also mention this user in the message text using format [user_id:team_id].

attached_to.title: Attached To

type.title: Type
type.description: Type of target (always 'design' for design-level comments)

design_id.title: Design Id
design_id.description: Design ID to attach comment to

attached_to.description: Required target reference specifying where comment should be attached

tools.name: CANVA_CREATE_DESIGN_IMPORT_JOB
tools.description: Imports an external file as a new Canva design. This endpoint converts documents (PDF, Word, PowerPoint, Excel) and design files (PSD, AI) into editable Canva designs. The import runs asynchronously and returns a job ID to track progress and retrieve the created design. IMPORTANT: This is an async operation. Use CANVA_RETRIEVE_DESIGN_IMPORT_JOB_STATUS to poll the job status until it reaches 'success' or 'failed' to get the final design ID.

inputSchema.title: CreateDesignImportJobRequest

file.title: FileUploadable
file.description: Document or design file to import (max 100MB). Formats: PDF, Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Photoshop, Illustrator, Keynote, Pages, Numbers, OpenDocument. PowerPoint loses animations, Excel loses formulas, AI/PSD may lose layers. Password-protected files fail.

title.title: Title
title.description: Title for the imported design (max 50 chars). Shows in Canva UI and design lists. Longer titles are truncated. Special characters allowed.

mime_type.title: Mime Type
mime_type.description: Optional MIME type override. If omitted, the file's mimetype is used.

inputSchema.description:
Request schema for starting a Canva design import job.

Canva expects the binary file in the request body (application/octet-stream)
and an Import-Metadata header with a small JSON payload.

tools.name: CANVA_CREATE_DESIGN_RESIZE_JOB
tools.description: Creates a resized copy of an existing design (Canva Pro/Enterprise only). This endpoint creates a new design with different dimensions from an existing one. The resize operation runs asynchronously and preserves content where possible. Returns a job ID to track progress and retrieve the new design once complete. IMPORTANT: This is an async operation. Use CANVA_RETRIEVE_DESIGN_RESIZE_JOB_STATUS to poll the job status until completion to get the resized design ID and access URLs.

inputSchema.title: CreateDesignResizeJobRequest

design_type.title: Design Type
design_type.description:
Target design type configuration. Must include 'type' field.

Two options:
1. Preset: {'type': 'preset', 'name': 'presentation'}
   - type: Must be 'preset'
   - name: Preset design type name (e.g., 'presentation', 'whiteboard', 'doc')

2. Custom: {'type': 'custom', 'width': 1080, 'height': 1920}
   - type: Must be 'custom'
   - width: Width in pixels (40-8000)
   - height: Height in pixels (40-8000)

inputSchema.description:
Start an async job to create a resized copy of a design.

Either provide a preset design type or custom dimensions.

tools.name: CANVA_CREATE_URL_ASSET_UPLOAD_JOB
tools.description: Tool to create an asynchronous Canva asset import job from a public URL. Use when you need to import an asset into Canva directly from a publicly accessible URL without S3 choreography.

inputSchema.title: CreateUrlAssetUploadJobRequest

url.title: Url
url.description: Publicly accessible URL of the file to import.

inputSchema.description: Parameters to start a URL-based asset upload job in Canva.

tools.name: CANVA_CREATE_USER_OR_SUB_FOLDER
tools.description: Creates a new folder in the user's Canva projects. This endpoint creates a single folder at the specified location (root level or inside another folder). Returns the new folder's ID, name, and timestamps. The created folder can store designs, assets, and subfolders.

inputSchema.title: CreateUserOrSubFolderRequest

name.title: Name
name.description: Folder name (max 255 chars). Empty names return 400 error. Duplicates are allowed. Special chars may work but could be sanitized.

parent_folder_id.title: Parent Folder Id
parent_folder_id.description: Parent folder ID where to create the folder. Defaults to 'root' (user's top-level). Invalid IDs return 404: 'Parent folder not found'. Get valid IDs from list operations.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for creating a folder in Canva.

tools.name: CANVA_DELETE_ASSET_BY_ID
tools.description: You can delete an asset by specifying its `assetId`. This operation mirrors the behavior in the Canva UI. Deleting an item moves it to the trash. Deleting an asset doesn't remove it from designs that already use it.

tools.name: CANVA_EXCHANGE_OAUTH20_ACCESS_OR_REFRESH_TOKEN
tools.description: The OAuth 2.0 endpoint issues time-limited (4-hour) access tokens of up to 4KB for user authorization via codes or refresh tokens. It requires client ID/secret for authentication.

tools.name: CANVA_FETCH_ASSET_UPLOAD_JOB_STATUS
tools.description: Polls for asset upload job completion status. Use this after CANVA_CREATE_ASSET_UPLOAD_JOB to check the upload progress. Repeatedly call this endpoint until a 'success' or 'failed' status is received to get the final asset ID and metadata.

tools.name: CANVA_FETCH_CANVA_CONNECT_SIGNING_PUBLIC_KEYS
tools.description: The API for verifying Canva webhooks, 'connect/keys,' is in preview, meaning unstable, not for public integrations, and provides a rotating JWK for signature verification to prevent replay attacks. Cache keys for efficiency.

tools.name: CANVA_FETCH_CURRENT_USER_DETAILS
tools.description: Returns the User ID, Team ID, and display name of the user account associated with the provided access token.

tools.name: CANVA_FETCH_DESIGN_METADATA_AND_ACCESS_INFORMATION
tools.description: Gets the metadata for a design. This includes owner information, URLs for editing and viewing, and thumbnail information.

tools.name: CANVA_GET_DESIGN_EXPORT_JOB_RESULT
tools.description: Polls for design export job completion status. Use this after CANVA_CREATE_CANVA_DESIGN_EXPORT_JOB to check the export progress. Call this endpoint repeatedly until the job is complete to receive download links for the exported design pages. Download URLs expire after 30 days.

tools.name: CANVA_INITIATE_CANVA_DESIGN_AUTOFILL_JOB
tools.description: Upcoming brand template ID updates require migration within 6 months. Canva Enterprise users can auto-fill designs using various data types, including experimental chart data. Monitor jobs with specific API.

data.title: Data
data.description: Data object containing the data fields and values to autofill.

title.title: Title
title.description: Title to use for the autofilled design. Must be less than 256 characters. If no design title is provided, the autofilled design will have the same title as the brand template.

brand_template_id.title: Brand Template Id
brand_template_id.description: ID of the input brand template.

tools.name: CANVA_LIST_DESIGN_PAGES_WITH_PAGINATION
tools.description: Preview API for Canva: subject to unannounced changes and not for public integrations. Lists metadata for design pages with optional `offset` and `limit`; not applicable to all design types.

limit.title: Limit
limit.description: The number of pages to return, starting at the page index specified using the `offset` parameter. Default is `50` pages.

offset.title: Offset
offset.description: The page index to start the range of pages to return. Default is `1`. Pages are indexed using one-based numbering, so the first page in a design has the index value `1`.

tools.name: CANVA_LIST_FOLDER_ITEMS_BY_TYPE_WITH_SORTING
tools.description: Lists the items in a folder, including each item's `type`. Folders can contain: - Other folders. - Designs, such as Instagram posts, Presentations, and Documents ([Canva Docs](https://www.canva.com/create/documents/)). - Image assets.

sort_by.title: Sort By
sort_by.description: Sort the list of folder items. This can be one of the following: - `created_ascending`: Sort results by creation date, in ascending order. - `created_descending`: Sort results by creation date, in descending order. - `modified_ascending`: Sort results by the last modified date, in ascending order. - `modified_descending`: (Default) Sort results by the last modified date, in descending order. - `title_ascending`: Sort results by title, in ascending order. The title is either the `name` field for a folder or asset, or the `title` field for a design. - `title_descending`: Sort results by title, in descending order. The title is either the `name` field for a folder or asset, or the `title` field for a design.

item_types.title: Item Types
item_types.description: Filter the folder items to only return specified types. The available types are: `design`, `folder`, and `image`. To filter for more than one item type, provide a comma- delimited list.

continuation.title: Continuation
continuation.description: If the success response contains a continuation token, the folder contains more items you can list. You can use this token as a query parameter and retrieve more items from the list, for example `/v1/folders/{folderId}/items?continuation={continuation}`. To retrieve all the items in a folder, you might need to make multiple requests.

tools.name: CANVA_LIST_USER_DESIGNS
tools.description: Provides a summary of Canva user designs, includes search filtering, and allows showing both self-created and shared designs with sorting options.

query.title: Query
query.description: Lets you search the user"s designs, and designs shared with the user, using a search term or terms.

sort_by.title: SortByEnm
sort_by.description: Sort the list of designs. This can be one of the following: - `relevance`: (Default) Sort results using a relevance algorithm. - `modified_descending`: Sort results by the date last modified in descending order. - `modified_ascending`: Sort results by the date last modified in ascending order. - `title_descending`: Sort results by title in descending order. - `title_ascending`: Sort results by title in ascending order.

ownership.title: OwnershipEnm
ownership.description: Filter the list of designs based on the user"s ownership of the designs. This can be one of the following: - `owned`: Designs owned by the user. - `shared`: Designs shared with the user. - `any`: Designs owned by and shared with the user.

continuation.title: Continuation
continuation.description: If the success response contains a continuation token, the list contains more designs you can list. You can use this token as a query parameter and retrieve more designs from the list, for example `/v1/designs?continuation={continuation}`. To retrieve all of a user"s designs, you might need to make multiple requests.

tools.name: CANVA_MOVE_ITEM_TO_SPECIFIED_FOLDER
tools.description: Transfers an item to a different folder by specifying both the destination folder's ID and the item's ID. If the item is in various folders, an error occurs; manual relocation via Canva UI is required.

item_id.title: Item Id
item_id.description: The ID of the item you want to move.

to_folder_id.title: To Folder Id
to_folder_id.description: The ID of the folder you want to move the item to (the destination folder). If you want to move the item to the top level of a Canva user"s [projects](https://www.canva.com/help/find-designs-and-folders/), use the ID `root`.

tools.name: CANVA_REMOVE_FOLDER_AND_MOVE_CONTENTS_TO_TRASH
tools.description: Deletes a folder by moving the user's content to Trash and reassigning other users' content to their top-level projects.

tools.name: CANVA_RETRIEVE_APP_PUBLIC_KEY_SET
tools.description: Returns the Json Web Key Set (public keys) of an app. These keys are used to verify JWTs sent to app backends.

tools.name: CANVA_RETRIEVE_A_SPECIFIC_DESIGN_COMMENT
tools.description: This preview API is subject to unannounced changes and can't be used in public integrations. It retrieves a comment, details of which are on Canva Help Center.

tools.name: CANVA_RETRIEVE_ASSET_METADATA_BY_ID
tools.description: You can retrieve the metadata of an asset by specifying its `assetId`.

tools.name: CANVA_RETRIEVE_BRAND_TEMPLATE_DATASET_DEFINITION
tools.description: Canva's brand template IDs will change later this year, including a 6-month integration migration. API access requires Enterprise membership, providing autofill for images, text, and charts, although chart data could change during preview.

tools.name: CANVA_RETRIEVE_CANVA_ENTERPRISE_BRAND_TEMPLATE_METADATA
tools.description: Upcoming update will change brand template IDs; integrations must migrate within 6 months. API use requires Canva Enterprise membership.

tools.name: CANVA_RETRIEVE_DESIGN_AUTOFILL_JOB_STATUS
tools.description: API users with Canva Enterprise membership can retrieve design autofill job results, potentially requiring multiple requests until a `success` or `failed` status is received.

tools.name: CANVA_RETRIEVE_DESIGN_IMPORT_JOB_STATUS
tools.description: Polls for design import job completion status. Use this after CANVA_CREATE_DESIGN_IMPORT_JOB to check the import progress. Repeatedly call this endpoint until a 'success' or 'failed' status is received to get the final imported design ID and metadata.

tools.name: CANVA_RETRIEVE_DESIGN_RESIZE_JOB_STATUS
tools.description: Retrieves the status and results of a design resize job. Polls for design resize job completion status. Use this after CANVA_CREATE_DESIGN_RESIZE_JOB to check the resize progress. Keep polling until status is 'success' or 'failed'. Successful jobs include the new design ID and temporary access URLs.

inputSchema.title: RetrieveDesignResizeJobStatusRequest

job_id.title: Job Id
job_id.description: The resize job ID returned from create resize job endpoint

inputSchema.description: Request to get the status of a design resize job.

tools.name: CANVA_RETRIEVE_FOLDER_DETAILS_BY_ID
tools.description: Gets the name and other details of a folder using a folder's `folderID`.

tools.name: CANVA_RETRIEVE_USER_PROFILE_DATA
tools.description: Currently, this returns the display name of the user account associated with the provided access token. More user information is expected to be included in the future.

tools.name: CANVA_REVOKE_OAUTH_TOKENS
tools.description: Revoke a refresh token to end its lineage and user consent, requiring re-authentication. Authenticate using either basic access with Base64-encoded credentials or body parameters with client ID and secret.

client_id.title: Client Id
client_id.description: Your integration"s unique ID, for authenticating the request. NOTE: We recommend that you use basic access authentication instead of specifying `client_id` and `client_secret` as body parameters.

client_secret.title: Client Secret
client_secret.description: Your integration"s client secret, for authenticating the request. Begins with `cnvca`. NOTE: We recommend that you use basic access authentication instead of specifying `client_id` and `client_secret` as body parameters.

tools.name: CANVA_UPDATE_ASSET_S_NAME_AND_TAGS_BY_ID
tools.description: You can update the name and tags of an asset by specifying its `assetId`. Updating the tags replaces all existing tags of the asset.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the asset. This is shown in the Canva UI. When this field is undefined, nothing is updated. Maximum length 50 characters.

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: The replacement tags for the asset. When this field is undefined, nothing is updated. Maximum length 50 tags. Each tag has a maximum length of 50 characters.

tools.name: CANVA_UPDATE_FOLDER_DETAILS_BY_ID
tools.description: Updates a folder's details using its `folderID`. Currently, you can only update a folder's name.

name.title: Name
name.description: The folder name, as shown in the Canva UI.

tools.name: CANVA_VALIDATE_OAUTH_TOKEN_PROPERTIES
tools.description: Check an access token's validity and properties via introspection, requiring authentication. Use Basic access (Base64 encoded `client_id:client_secret`) or body parameters for credentialing.

client_id.title: Client Id
client_id.description: Your integration"s unique ID, for authenticating the request. NOTE: We recommend that you use basic access authentication instead of specifying `client_id` and `client_secret` as body parameters.

client_secret.title: Client Secret
client_secret.description: Your integration"s client secret, for authenticating the request. Begins with `cnvca`. NOTE: We recommend that you use basic access authentication instead of specifying `client_id` and `client_secret` as body parameters.
